pullrequest.title: Feature System Part 7: Features for programmatic construction of objects

content.raw:
DART will automatically add a numerical suffix whenever a duplicated name is given to an object that manages a unique set of names. DART will print a notification about this to stdout when it happens, which may produce undesirable noise.

However, in this case, this prismatic joint is going to be replaced by the one that gets created on line 88, so there won’t be any point in time where the joint name would be duplicated, and so no notification would get printed.

I’m not actually sure if this is intentional, though. Nothing is done with `child` nor the prismatic joint we’re creating here; it just gets replaced by the later one. I might have intended this to be a test that joints can be replaced, although I should have left a note of that if that’s what I intended.

So I think we can either \(1\) remove this line, or \(2\) add a note explaining that is used to test that joints can be replaced.
content.html:
DART will automatically add a numerical suffix whenever a duplicated name is given to an object that manages a unique set of names. DART will print a notification about this to stdout when it happens, which may produce undesirable noise.

However, in this case, this prismatic joint is going to be replaced by the one that gets created on line 88, so there won’t be any point in time where the joint name would be duplicated, and so no notification would get printed.

I’m not actually sure if this is intentional, though. Nothing is done with child nor the prismatic joint we’re creating here; it just gets replaced by the later one. I might have intended this to be a test that joints can be replaced, although I should have left a note of that if that’s what I intended.

So I think we can either (1) remove this line, or (2) add a note explaining that is used to test that joints can be replaced.
